distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Spotify Charts (All Audio Data) dataset

distribution.name: merged_data.csv
distribution.description: Dataset file that contains all data

field.description: id

field.name: title
field.description: str

field.name: rank
field.description: int

field.name: date
field.description: date

field.name: artist
field.description: str

field.name: url
field.description: str

field.name: region
field.description: category

field.name: chart
field.description: category

field.name: trend
field.description: category

field.name: streams
field.description: int

field.name: track_id
field.description: Unique identifier for each track

field.name: album
field.description: The album in which the track belongs.

field.name: popularity
field.description: A measure of the track's popularity, typically based on factors like number of streams, downloads, and listener engagement.

field.name: duration_ms
field.description: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

field.name: explicit
field.description: Indicates whether the track contains explicit content (1 for explicit, 0 for not explicit).

field.name: release_date
field.description: The date when the track was released.

field.name: available_markets
field.description: The markets where the track is available for streaming.

field.name: af_danceability
field.description: A metric representing how suitable a track is for dancing, based on elements like tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity.

field.name: af_energy
field.description: A measure of the intensity and activity of a track.

field.name: af_key
field.description: The key the track is in.

field.name: af_loudness
field.description: The overall loudness of the track in decibels (dB).

field.name: af_mode
field.description: Indicates whether the track is in a major (1) or minor (0) key.

field.name: af_speechiness
field.description: Detects the presence of spoken words in the track (e.g., rap or spoken poetry).

field.name: af_acousticness
field.description: A measure of the acoustic characteristics of the track, where 0 represents high confidence that the track is not acoustic and 1 represents high confidence that it is.

field.name: af_instrumentalness
field.description: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals, where 1 indicates high confidence that the track is instrumental.

field.name: af_liveness
field.description: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording.

field.name: af_valence
field.description: Describes the musical positiveness of the track, where high values represent positive valence (e.g., happy, cheerful) and low values represent negative valence (e.g., sad, depressed).

field.name: af_tempo
field.description: The tempo of the track in beats per minute (BPM).

field.name: af_time_signature
field.description: The time signature of the track, indicating the number of beats in each bar and the type of note that receives one beat.

recordSet.name: merged_data.csv
recordSet.description: Dataset file that contains all data

name: Spotify Charts (All Audio Data)
description: #### Content This is a complete dataset of all the "Top 200" and "Viral 50" charts published globally by Spotify. Spotify publishes a new chart every 2-3 days. This is its entire collection since January 1, 2019. This dataset is a continuation of the Kaggle Dataset: [Spotify Charts](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/dhruvildave/spotify-charts) but contains 29 rows for each row that was populated using the Spotify API. #### Note The value of streams is NULL when the chart column is "viral50". #### Acknowledgment Base Dataset: [Spotify Charts](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/dhruvildave/spotify-charts) Photo by Alexander Shatov on Unsplash
